text: We now always fix Dropbox and Google Docs links when you add/edit them in Settings, not just when first creating the goal.
We made a proper landing page for URLminder: https://t.co/inzZoBJwLW
We changed the smoothing constant for the purple line for weight loss and other noisy data goals from .1 to .25. https://t.co/jiihH9EkQc
We upgraded our db & got graph regen times back down to ~5s. Phew! Now we may have to work on mass-editing of goals https://t.co/UxuUPun2yo
#bugfix for the +/- stepper buttons for Garmin & Epson goal creation: hitting the "-" button would increase the value. Negation is tricky!
Another #bugfix with Fitbit number-of-activities goals: we used the wrong endpoint and only got ones added via the website, not devices
URLminder now magically fixes Dropbox links so you can beemind wordcount for any plaintext document you have sync'd with Dropbox
Fixed a bug with creating new Fitbit number-of-activities goal. The initial import of last week of data could insta-derail you. #bugfix
Fixed a big with strange font sizes of goalnames on the dashboard. #bugfix https://t.co/vSDFA5rueq
Also URLminder now supports arbitrary deadlines!
You can now see and update the list of URLminder URLs in your goal settings. Makes URLminder much more useful! https://t.co/1ruqwmNwAC
Email replies when you add data via the bot now never totally fail to send if we can't fetch one of the random tips of the day. #bugfix
Fixed the hovertext for datapoints to always show the relevant metadata and not redundantly repeat the comment as hovertext. #mini
We now support Swahili in @duolingo! And a #mini UVI: Tooltips in the header of the big table for setting reminders for all goals at once.
Fixed a bug in the dashboard where quickly tripleclicking the goal would show the add data form below the collapsed goal. #bugfix
We fixed some annoying things with the guest access (for beemium people) to our dev chat: URLs work now, and disconnects handled better
We made updates via the website & Android & iOS all have higher priority which noticeably improved graph regeneration times (tho still bad)
We fixed our SMTP/DNS/whatever settings so outgoing mail doesn't say "sent via mailgun dot org" in Gmail. #mini HT our CEO's mother
Added link to forum post which explains the aggday custom goal setting. & Fitbit "number activities" was buggy for the 1st 11 days. #bugfix
We made our jobs page -- https://t.co/Z54qVa4oZd -- less out of date and embarrassing! And added a little "need help?" footer link.
Fixed a bug where sometimes the tabs below the graph would be completely blank until you reloaded the page. #bugfix
iPhone app couldn't handle safety buffer >32767 days so now we cap it at that. Also fixed a redesign regression as part of prev UVI. #bugfix
Feature! We trust our users so much that when you update a failed payment method you can actually pick which charges should be retried!
We again let you jump from $0 to $5 pledged (even without the Beemium plan that lets you jump to any amount). #bugfix #redesign-regression
We made the goal descriptions smaller because we're very opinionated about people focusing on the goalnames as the main identifiers of goals
We added "number of activities" as a thing you can beemind via @fitbit (& removed "very active time" since Fitbit doesn't support that now)
We now support Romanian as one of the languages you can beemind learning on @duolingo!
We now have proper error handling for losing authorization to read a user's @todoist data. #mini #bugfix
At some point our push notifications for the Android app broke which made graphs appear to be regenerating forever. #bugfix #firebase
#mini UVIs: new Epson logo, made table in the middle of https://t.co/e0pAMoXjIf not ugly (#redesign), tweaked flash banner for premium plans
Super facepalmy bug made us forget toggle states (countdown vs time, expanded vs not, etc) on dashboard after visiting new goal page #bugfix
#bugfix w/ goal wizard that'd occasionally/rarely give a blank page when creating a goal (related to bad state from previous goal creation)
I guess we'll count this: We now have an informative static image to show in place of graphs in case Amazon goes down and won't show them...
#bugfix: The iPhone beemergency badge icon didn't show up unless you remembered to manually launch the app every single day. HT Paul Schmidt
#bugfix kind of: the dates used for the add-data form were being too clever and magically updating when your deadline hit; caused confusion!
Added a new premium FAQ item at https://t.co/arZxzvSs86. Includes my ill-advised murder joke. #yolo #mini
#bugfix in URLminder: don't add a new datapoint every single time we check, only when wordcount has actually changed https://t.co/gP0wulLW0r
When you had non-midnight deadlines for a goal we'd sometimes show you the wrong date for adding new data. #redesign #bugfix
Fixed missing newline in text under graph thumbnails in gallery view. #mini #bugfix #redesign And show full goal description as hovertext.
We now show both the goalname and the description (the latter in a tiny font) on the dashboard. No more confusing toggling (for goalnames)!
In goal settings for @trello goals we now link to the actual board that we're pulling data from.
And a super #mini one: made the pledge box not have an "i'm a button" shadow if you're looking at someone else's goal so it's not clickable
More #mini UVIs: shrunk annoyingly large navigation header, made archived gallery show 4 across, link to archive in gallery view.
Made the navigation header not annoyingly large. Also: tweaks to https://t.co/BSB4dTXLFz: Capitalize "Hours", make our titles fit on 1 line.
A bunch of small improvements to our datapoint format checker. You can see all the crazy example parsings at https://t.co/ATJ93AKIMj
Somewhat smarter rounding and don't show integers as X.00. And another #mini #bugfix with sometimes showing "++HH:MM" instead of "+HH:MM"
Fixed a 500-error involving displaying bare-mins as HH:MM for ended goals. Also stopped showing HH:MM:SS in recent data. #bugfix
Fixed a nasty bug w/ road dial where we'd mess up the last segment of your road when you changed the rate units (daily/weekly/etc). #bugfix
For goals denominated in hours we now display amounts in HH:MM in most places on the website.
We added "make private" to "new goal settings" in account settings if you want all new goals to default to private. https://t.co/fq3iJXv7Pw
Fixed a bug that meant we wouldn't show you even landing pages of some autodata integrations if you hadn't entered a credit card. #bugfix
Fixed a bug in the URLminder magic that lets us fetch the plaintext version of a Google doc. https://t.co/1ruqwmNwAC #bugfix
API #bugfix: the requestid param only did worked as advertised for creating single datapoints, not create_all. HT John Swanson
Thing we broke like a year ago: when fetching your initial GmailZero count, if it's too big to fetch, we once again tell you that. #bugfix
Used to be that every time we autoratched (automatically capping safety buffer) the graph would get stuck w/ buzzy bee for 5-10min. #bugfix
We can now link directly to specific tabs in account settings, eg, https://t.co/2qbqauISof
Custom fine print for goals is publicly visible again and we allow hyperlinks. https://t.co/V2i23EkfYc
Previous UVI also fixed a nasty focus bug when entering data in succession in dashboard. Also related: we killed reverse sorting.
Mini #bugfix / UI-polish with expanding/collapsing the goals: if you do it to all of them one by one you can still undo w/ 1 click in header
We used to magically re-sort the dashboard when you entered data but that turned out to be a bad idea; now you can click "DEADLINE" to do so
More #mini UVIs: nixed superfluous logged in/out banners, fixed links to create goals on https://t.co/J7RepperN0 and https://t.co/P2QHCEFYsG
UI tweak in Gitminder goal creation: automatically switch the radio button to specific repository if you start to type one. #mini
More tweaks to error banners so that important ones don't get obscured. #mini
Gitminder goal creation now handles the case revoked Beeminder's authorization on GitHub (& maybe other cases of bad GitHub credentials)
We now show the expanded road dial (w/ end date & end value as well as rate) if the goal is ending within 30 days (too magical?)
Another embarrassing thing we broke w/ redesign: If you said "hide y-axis" for a while we weren't also hiding stats that leaked that info.
Fixed a couple UI bugs with changing goalnames (& #bugfix w/ using numbers as goalnames). https://t.co/tmgKio3QUI
All Fitbit goals were getting created as Do More (or failing altogether?) for 2 months after we launched the redesign. #bugfix
We're obviously very behind on UVI tweets because we're just getting to our official Todoist integration! https://t.co/mdgBcA6gez
We're now consistent for all autodata goal creation in giving you the option to start with an arbitrary amount of safety buffer
This counts as a UVI but we're not yet happy with the interaction between goal units & things like y-axis label: https://t.co/cP1WKpFVEf
On /archived it says "No archived goals!"if you have none. And on the front page, link to autodata landing pages, not goal creation. #mini
You can now change the default GmailZero query when creating GmailZero goals, instead of having to go digging in settings afterwards.
UI improvement: x-max can't be in the past and x-min can't be in the future. #mini
Fixed a 500 error for the case of opening the pledge popup for a goal (maybe just on archived goals?) with no credit card on file. #bugfix
We now use your chosen timezone in your Beeminder settings for showing "today"/"yesterday", not whatever your browser thinks. #bugfix
One more thing we broke in the redesign: we weren't allowing a negative rate for Fitbit net calories goals. #bugfix
Pledge stepper now indicates when it hits its limit (eg, you can't pledge more than $2430). #mini
Added button on goal page to archive frozen goals. Bonus #mini UVI: datapoint value is cleared when you submit it on dashboard.
Mini UVIs: We now refresh graph after updating weekends-off, higher-res Duolingo logo, more obvious link to change goal date / goal total
Removed now-meaningless backburner line in reminder settings, and brought back all autodata settings that got lost in the redesign
Don't mention "safe days" in bot email subject when it exceeds days till goal end date. Also iOS notifications now make the default sound.
Avoided a bunch of confusion by nixing the instant-archive buttons in the dashboard for frozen/completed goals; all done from goal pages now
If you set a default deadline we were accidentally applying that to autodata goals that don't support arbitrary deadlines. #bugfix
Mini #bugfix w/ pointlessly clickable things when viewing other people's graphs. Also cleaned up CSS bugs on some landing pages.
Fixed checkbox that was acting like expand/collapse instead of a checkbox for whether to auto-increase pledges when you derail. mini #bugfix
Fixed a case of showing the wrong new pledge amount in the legit check email if you had auto-increasing pledges turned off. #bugfix
Fixed a couple small bugs with trying to get a premium plan without being initially logged in. #bugfix HT @pennockd
Critical #bugfix w/ iOS app that made us fail to push reminders under some mysterious circumstances involving frozen/archived goals
If you sent auth token but didn't specify the user we 500'd even tho w/ auth token it had to be you that you're requesting for. API #bugfix
For over a month after the redesign we had a bug that let you sometimes create pledgeless goals w/out a premium plan. Gasp! #bugfix
Moved password to separate section in settings which fixed bug w/ some browsers that wouldn't let you change settings w/o changing password
Fixed a bug involving the pledge amount being in two places. Now it's still in commitment settings too but pops up the same modal. #bugfix
Fixed bunch of cases where we used goal description instead of goalname, which to some people's chagrin is now the universal goal identifier
Fixed broken CSS on various autodata landing pages and the unsubscribe page
Marginally better "doom text" for weight loss; bigger body font; made 3rd-party font library local cuz it was killing response time. #mini
Version 4.4 of iOS app cont'd: Bug fixes in push notifications, & you can tap Create Goal to go to the website pre-logged-in to create goals
Also in the new version of the iOS app: a Reset Data button to reload all goals, no more backburner dividing line, ...
Version 4.4 of the Beeminder iOS app is live! Most important for brand new users: you can now create a Beeminder account from it.
And a separate bug w/ our @habitica integration: for Do More goals we were starting the yellow brick road too high by 1 To-Do. #bugfix
Nasty bug with our @habitica integration: all the Fewer To-Dos goals were being created as Do Mores (redesign bug). #bugfix
Fixed an intermittent bug where you'd hit archive & the goal would mysteriously not archive if a previous goal w/ that name existed. #bugfix
Yet another bug from redesign: If you signed up via Google oauth and then created a Do More goal we'd create it as a GmailZero goal. #bugfix
By popular demand: our blog has a (@duckduckgo) searchbox. Seek & ye shall find. Dark days of adding "beeminder blog" to a web search: over!
Fixed small bug with plus/minus buttons for data entry on odometer goals, and fixed a link to reminder settings in bot emails. #bugfix
Our Garmin stepcounts were sometimes too low. Garmin's granular API didn't agree with its summary data. We now use summary. #bugfix
GmailZero #bugfix in which we were fetching your initial inbox count but then starting your road at 0 anyway for a while.
We rewrote the copy at https://t.co/oyE80p8Jrx which was a little broken since the Infinibee premium revamp. #mini
Embarrassingly there was a full month after the redesign when we set everyone's default timezone to US Eastern time. #bugfix
If a goalname's disallowed (eg "gallery" or existing goalnames) also disallow uppercase variants like "Gallery" or things break. #bugfix
Dumb #bugfix w/ Fitbit goal creation: gave error if you didn't change the default settings. (ps: bugs intro'd by redesign count again now)
Fixed longstanding bug that would sometimes insta-derail you when importing old RescueTime & Withings data when creating goals. #bugfix
If a goal is coasting (will hit goal value by goal date even if you do/report nothing) we now show it green w/ the correct wording. #bugfix
If goalname & blurb are same except case, don't toggle betw them on dashboard (looked like we'd implemented idiotic case-toggling feature!)
Thumbnails also clickable even when infinibee buzzing (especially nice now that goalnames/goalblurbs toggle instead of linking to goal page)
Made the thumbnails collapse nicely even when the infinibee is buzzing on top of them (and keep buzzing in collapsed form)
Fixed a 500 error when restarting an old GmailZero goal from before Google oauth params changed. Now backwards compatible. #bugfix #mini
When we email you about an error in an IFTTT recipe we now include a link to the errant recipe. Handy!
Mostly fixed the problem with missing graph images on the dashboard (but it still happens occasionally...). #bugfix #mostly #staytuned
Fixed old instance of calling Habitica HabitRPG in bot email, fixed bug that made us miss points on Duolingo for Norwegian. #bugfix
If you create a goal with only post-dated data we now give a more elucidating error about why we can't show you a graph. #mini
If you have a pledge stepdown scheduled you can set the pledge cap to what it's stepping down to; removed most of the confusing interactions
New NaNoWriMo landing page with buttons for automatic and manual tracking: https://t.co/1ruqwmNwAC
We magically turn links to google docs into the plaintext version for URLminder so we get the real wordcount without extraneous html
URLminder is an official integration! Automatically mind wordcounts of documents at any publicly accessible URLs. https://t.co/M8rSTMLcSN
The hashtag-minding part of our Twitter integration was broken since forever (workaround was via IFTTT) but is now fixed. #bugfix
Minis: 1. when showing the goalname, show goal description as hovertext; 2. jump straight to 1 when clicking the plus for datapoint value
A kludge but a very noticeable improvement: we no longer let you insta-derail yourself by ratcheting the day after derailing
Minis: Query tags case-insensitively, road editor from Commitment to Settings tab, #bugfix's w/ submit button & enforcing ratchet bounds
Changing the rate units in the road dial now does the arithmetic for you, like turning 7/week into 1/day, immediately, before hitting submit
Fixed some cases in alerts where we used the old "title" (what's now the goal description) to identify goals instead of the goalname #bugfix
If you accidentally try to submit a datapoint without filling in the value it now turns the field red so it's nice and obvious what happened
Collection of #mini UVIs: Ellipses for long goalnames, header for data entry box, more readable data table when it's not editable
There's no longer any limit on the number of days of initial safety buffer when creating a goal
...which includes broken links, broken features like changing passwords, missing settings, backburner-goal brokenness in iOS, etc etc. 5/5
...we're not going to count anything else up to today that the redesign broke, other than this tweetstorm's worth: 4/5
But we were insufficiently careful when deploying the redesign, so, as self-punishment (& due to overwhelm at the sheer number of UVIs) 3/5
We're fixing them as fast as we can and normally each individual #bugfix would be totally fair game as a separate UVI. 2/5
Tweetstorm about the flurry of bugfixes since deploying the redesign: We broke an embarrassing number of things! 1/5
Almost forgot the biggest sluggy UVI: Anyone can edit their goalname any time (w/ big warning about breaking URLs and IFTTT recipes etc)
4) Finally, to get as close as we're going to for now to the best of all worlds: click to toggle between goalname/description on dashboard
3) You can edit the description at any time at the top of the goal page;
2) We now ask for both goalname (previously known as "slug") and description (previously "title") when creating goals;
We did several things with goalnames and descriptions: 1) descriptions viewable as tooltips on the dashboard;
Small API improvement: Goal object now includes last_datapoint
Similarly when there was an error preventing the graph from generating. We'll say this UVI covers all similar bugs introduced by redesign.
If you loaded the goal page and there was no previous datapoint then we were giving a 500 error. #bugfix
More things we forgot to include in the redesign tweetstorm: stepper buttons for datapoint values etc, displaying far future dates in years.
When you check or uncheck the Pessimistic Presumptive checkbox it instantly saves the setting and tells you so. Other settings to follow.
Fixed several cases (eg, the help text for the Due By table) of saying Value instead of Total or vice versa. #mini
Smarter use of "Sun night", "tomorrow", etc in deadline blurbs. Eg, saying "tomorrow" instead of "Sun" if within 24 hours of the deadline.
We now remember which goals on the dashboard you expanded/collapsed (& #bugfix today: it used to not work if you started from all-expanded)
In Withings goal creation we now validate that you give us an initial weight (though this seems to not work in Safari, frustratingly) #mini
When we launched the redesign we showed your full name in the public version of your gallery; that was a bad choice and we undid it that day
We now actually make sure the repo you want to mind exists and that you have access to it when you create a Gitminder goal
Redesign broke @habitica goal creation briefly! Newly created goals were failing to pick up new To-dos. #bugfix
Huge amount of aesthetic improvements & UI tweaks, hexagonal buttons, etc etc. This concludes the main tweetstorm for the redesign! (26/26)
We separated reminder defaults from other goal defaults. Two submit buttons on one page separated by lots of scrolling was a mess.
New, helpful placeholder text in fields in the goal creation wizard
Final row of the road editor is insta-updated when using the normal road dial (was moot in old design but nice having these on same page)
We now use the live time-bomb countdown for goals within a week of derailing and say "months" & "years" for goals with far deadlines
Negative UVI but it was really a confusing, dangerous feature: backburnering is dead. Tag things "backburner" & filter them out instead!
Tagging is multiple UVIs' worth so we'll use this tweet to say that, yes, a real UI is coming. Current version subsumes backburnering.
Tagging! Manage tags at https://t.co/0A8DvGoJci & then filter your dashboard via url-hacking, eg bmndrâ€¢com/user#tag or #!tag to exclude
So much confusing stuff now out of newbees' line of sight but all still conveniently acceessible in the tabs below the graph
You can now instantly delete goals from your gallery of archived goals
The Data tab is updated immediately when you add data and there's a "stats out of date" warning as a stopgap instead of just being stale
Arguably a negative UVI but since we're drastically undercounting anyway: we killed the auto-quit feature. It was deeply unbeemindery!
The banner messages that appear at the top are much nicer, disappearing when it makes sense to and persisting otherwise
Data entry now shows the goal units (not to mention all the increased prettiness, but that applies everywhere)
For autodata goals on the dashboard we have the icon for the data source and a nice hexagonal "force a fetch of more data" button
You can now choose today vs yesterday when entering data from the dashboard.
New dashboard lets you expand/collapse individual goals (pro-tip: use it like a to-do list, collapsing when done with a goal for the day)
Handy asterisk on the pledge telling you when you've hit your pledge cap, plus clearer indicator of pending pledge step-down
The buttons for delta vs absolute (and for absolute vs "t minus" deadline time) remember which way you like them per goal
Togglable buttons telling you the bare min or hard cap you need in terms of either the delta or the absolute number.
Table of reminder settings for all goals can sort by goal, deadline, zenostart, etc. Nice for setting up waterfalls: https://t.co/g29yJfw8uX
There's a button to delete your whole account if less than a week old or no active goals. The rest of https://t.co/lIKYIzIkcm coming later.
And import/export and rescaling of data is now all below the data
Editing data in the data table is also much nicer: you can just edit in place without first clicking a button
The Data tab is much nicer, lets you load all datapoints on one page, sort by any column, and it all happens right below the graph
Bee-yootiful new redesign! Massive number of UVIs in this. Here begins a tweetstorm of the most noteworthy! (1/26)
Seemingly #mini UVI that's part of something huge: we now disallow the goalname "gallery" (part of getting best of all worlds w/ redesign)
Better security: nonce URLs for graph images and thumbnails actually expire (totally new ones each time the graph is generated)
Moved all the graph images to S3: makes a noticeable difference in how fast goal galleries load & expected to even improve server stability
Also on https://t.co/arZxzvSs86: stopped confusingly saying "$0" for the lifetime plan you already have. Plus handy new FAQ item & hovertext
Fixed a bug in how prices of lower premium plans were displayed to people already on a higher lifetime plan (now just says "$N/A"). #bugfix
Fixed, de-duped, and rearranged footer links. #mini
Email bot no longer silently (well, it was calling in us humans to intervene) fails on data-like datapoints that're not actually parsable
Got rid of superfluous fields in past pledges export and added a CSV version as well as JSON
In case you have too many past pledges to show, we made a button that emails you the whole enchilada, in json format.
Can now add a phone number even if you don't use the SMS bot (and we'll actually text/call if you derail at $810+ & don't respond to email)
SMS bot improvement: until you activate your phone number we give a link to resend the activation text message
If you downgraded and lost the SMS bot perk, we'd get horribly confused and not let you save user settings anymore. #bugfix
Slightly more sophisticated error checking in our Twitter goal setup: give an error if the user doesn't exist or their tweets are protected.
More cleanup of https://t.co/BSB4dTXLFz & finally added @lady_alys who's been helping us w/ support & @habitica integration for a long time
Added our new Minister of the Exterior, @anomalily, to our About Us page. https://t.co/BSB4dTGaO1 Welcome Lillian! https://t.co/4St03HIKCh
Failed/frozen goals (with the skull & crossbones) can now be instantly archived. Sorry we were so uptight about that for so long!
Crazy mongoid bug made rescale feature break, rarely. Probable #bugfix deployed plus instrumentation so we'll know for sure if happens again
New premium FAQs about upgrading and downgrading and exquisite fairness, with new links and hovertext. https://t.co/br3KH0kiGG
On the email unsubscribe page, "you have N active goals" now links to your gallery in case you forgot what you were once beeminding. #mini
Forcing email confirmation before adding credit card spawned a couple bugs for grandfathered users, not allowing changing cc, etc #bugfix
3/ ... subscription level and number of active goals, and the button helpfully goes away on that page once it's done its job.
2/ ... still tells you what's up if you visit the link multiple times, doesn't try to redirect to goal gallery, tells you your beemail ...
1/ More helpful unsubscribe link! Sends you to a page with a big red button, is clear about what happens if you press it, ...
Instead of just strongly suggesting it (via banner) we now force you to confirm your email before letting you give us your credit card
When you create a goal w/ the API you can now specify the data source (manual, api, ifttt, zapier). HT @Malcolm_Ocean & @CompliceGoals
Rounding bug w/ applying coupons for premium plans could make displayed price a whole dollar off :/ #bugfix HT Markos Giannopoulos
#bugfix w/ creating @SkritterHQ goals: worked around changes on Skritter side. Now at least works smoothly if already logged in to Skritter.
If you're not premium we strip html tags from your "about me" blurb & add a nofollow to the "personal url" when linked under your avatar
Moved the discount slider back to the top and added an FAQ item to https://t.co/arZxzvSs86
Facebook sharing #bugfix: it was picking the wrong image because we tried to specify the thumbnail which isn't on the page being shared
We improved the Facebook share button: shows both goalname & title if different, & to round out this tiny UVI: fixed a typo in goal settings
Another embarrassing one: 1st attempt (7/04) to fix broken image links (rails asset pipeline) left several broken that we just now #bugfix'd
Fixed our dumb Facebook share button (on the goal pages) that's been broken for we-don't-know-how-long. HT @florismk
Bug w/ downgrading premium plans if you had a coupon discount: we failed to apply it! Gulp! #bugfix HT @my9goofie (And manually did refunds)
We updated/clarified the list of weasel restrictions in goal settings: no editing or manually adding data to autodata goals, no deleting
Bugfix of the #bugfix (HT @lady_alys for both): accidentally truncated @habitica goals to start from today; manually fixed everyone affected
#bugfix in @habitica more-Todos goal creation: would start road at 0 but credit you w/ all to-dos ever completed => unreasonably big buffer
In some thankfully rare cases, if you chose Slack DM for zeno alerts, they'd not show up (forgot to make sure DM channel was open) #bugfix
Y'know how weasel-proofed goals aren't deletable in the first week like normal? Buggily, the archive button wasn't working either. #bugfix
Another bug in /premium with how pricing was displayed (when on a legacy plan, it looked like Infinibee cost more than Bee Plus) #bugfix
If you came to /premium w/ a coupon code we'd forget it after page reload after clicking a button to add a plan. Coupon worked but.. #bugfix
And added a comment box with the "more free goals" & "discount please" buttons, for stating your case (and giving us much-needed feedback!)
The first time you push the "more free goals" button we just give you one automatically. Not sure how we feel about that, but, experiments!
In the premium revamp, introduced a bug that prevented creation of weight gain goals. This is America so it took a while to notice. #bugfix
Closed couple loopholes that let you apply discount coupons to legacy plans; also updates & additions ("Loophole idea!") to the premium FAQ
Another tiny one: Lifetime subscribers to legacy plans now see the plan description even if they've upgraded to another plan
Minis on https://t.co/arZxzvSs86: Link to new blog post, clicking Sign Up button pops up a popup to sign up (but redirects you away after)
Added link to datapoints on archived goals. No need to hide data, though still can't edit/delete it. HT Kenn Hamm https://t.co/gdhqdmUWuY
Forgot html_safe in zeno emails so were sending literal "<a href='...." etc. #bugfix HT Markos Giannopoulos
Replaced another instance of our janky credit card form with @stripe's elegant one, on the /premium page when you click Add Payment
Plugged leak in the commit-wall: creating various autodata goals circumvented the prompt to add your credit card before creating more goals
Speaking of dangling carrots, the charities weren't clickable in Beemium when we first deployed this. HT Kenn Hamm https://t.co/8BNnmsshmn
Changed the features listed for Core Beeminder in https://t.co/arZxzvSs86 based on this poll: https://t.co/RmulKzJEjb
Made the "discount please" button on https://t.co/arZxzvSs86 do something more sensible if you're not logged in (like telling you to do so)
Added a link to https://t.co/arZxzvSs86 in the top navigation bar, and edits in the FAQ etc to get in line with premium changes
Made a button on the new paywall to request additional free goals if you need more time to experiment or already pay lots in pledges
We tested when to make you add a credit card (commit-wall, not paywall), found earlier is better so now we do that after 1 or 2 goals
Lifetime subscriptions are clearer. Rather than just disabling the plan button it says "lifetime subscribed".
Now clearer how to switch between plans: plan you're on highlighted, says "currently subscribed", can click "downgrade" to downgrade, etc.
We now treat Core Beeminder (ie, the $0/month plan) as one of the plans. And btw, we're retiring the Beekeeper lifecoaching program. RIP.
New premium FAQ at the bottom of https://t.co/arZxzvSs86 and moved the Exquisitely Fair Slider below the plan blurbs
Similarly, if you're logged in but haven't added a credit card then the buttons say "Add Payment Method"
